summary: I feel like a terrible MCU fan for disliking Captain Marvel. I tend to be able to suspend disbelief and/or mindlessly be...
body: I feel like a terrible MCU fan for disliking Captain Marvel. I tend to be able to suspend disbelief and/or mindlessly be entertained. I couldn’t with Captain Marvel, I found it boring and overdone, I couldn’t keep myself interested, it felt like I was watching DC. Idk, I know that people either loved it or hated it.

reblog.comment: I feel like a terrible MCU fan for disliking Captain Marvel. I tend to be able to suspend disbelief and/or mindlessly be entertained. I couldn’t with Captain Marvel, I found it boring and overdone, I couldn’t keep myself interested, it felt like I was watching DC. Idk, I know that people either loved it or hated it.

trail.content_raw: I feel like a terrible MCU fan for disliking Captain Marvel. I tend to be able to suspend disbelief and/or mindlessly be entertained. I couldn’t with Captain Marvel, I found it boring and overdone, I couldn’t keep myself interested, it felt like I was watching DC. Idk, I know that people either loved it or hated it.
trail.content: I feel like a terrible MCU fan for disliking Captain Marvel. I tend to be able to suspend disbelief and/or mindlessly be entertained. I couldn’t with Captain Marvel, I found it boring and overdone, I couldn’t keep myself interested, it felt like I was watching DC. Idk, I know that people either loved it or hated it.

summary: You Don’t Have To Be A Fan Of The Comics To Be A Fan Of The Movies.
title: You Don’t Have To Be A Fan Of The Comics To Be A Fan Of The Movies.
body:
I love Captain Marvel! However I tried one of her comics, and I’m not gonna be reading/keeping up with them. I mean the comic wasn’t bad by any means, it was quite good and I enjoyed it and all, but it didn’t suck me in enough that I’m gonna collect it the way I’m collecting other comics (like Ms Marvel or All New Wolverine for example).

But that doesn’t mean I’m not a Captain Marvel fan. At least when it comes to the MCU version. In the MCU, Carol is easily my second favourite character now and I CANNOT wait for her to have another movie. I’m really looking forward to seeing Brie in the role again, and we know it’s gonna be awesome and I’m really giddy, if that wasn’t already obvious, lol.

But again, I’m not crazy in love with her comics.

I just say this because I see some people suggesting that unless you’re a fan of the comics, you’re not a “real” fan, or you’re somehow a hypocrite or so on. And yes, the whole “real” fan thing has been beyond stupid since people first started using it way back when, but it seems the idiocy hasn’t quite died away, so here we are. Once again defending that a fan is someone who enjoys something - not someone who has all knowledge about it memorised off by heart at the drop of a hat.

summary:
Nick, standing on the porch outside Tony and Pepper’s home. Staring off the lake after the ceremony has been presented.
Carol,...
body:
Nick, standing on the porch outside Tony and Pepper’s home. Staring off the lake after the ceremony has been presented.

Carol, comes in and stands next to him crossing her arms: So these are the heroes you set to watch? Earth’s mightest heroes?

Nick, not taking his glance away from the lake: Heroes…It’s an old fashion notion…

Carol: I see…Notice your…heroes are called the Avengers huh? I also saw a picture of me back in the 90’s again, you know the times where I had a life here and notice my codename is ‘Avenger’ on the side jet?

Nick, corner of his lips lifted a bit: You open my eyes Vers, first time to see that we are truly not alone in the universe. Decided to set up a team of people…just…like you, to protect the world when we needed them too, to fight the battles that no one else ever could.

Carol, looks ahead to see the remainder of the original Avengers, gather close: And they did…they really did…I’m grateful for them stepping up.

Nick: Lost my two great eyes.

Carol: Three if you count a physical eye?

Nick, looks at her. Both of them smile: Will you be staying around this time?

Carol, looks back staring at the group of heroes once again: Can’t. Still have to patrol around the planets to see if all life has return, but Earth is in good hands. They may lost two people who stand in, and sacrifice their own to save others, but they can fill in the gap and protect the world once again. It’s not about me, it’s about them.

Nick nods, stare at the lake once again. Carol follows his glance and looks ahead as well.

Carol: What happen to Goose by the way?

title: Plus One
body:
Requested by: anonymous FAKE DATING AU WITH CAROL DANVERS 😭

You choke on your drink when you see your ex walk into the bar. It takes everything in you not to vomit when you see the beautiful woman draped in his arms. 

“Is something wrong,” the woman next to you asks.

“My fucking ex just walked in and-” your eyes follow his path straight to you. “And it looks like he can’t resist showing me who won the break-up.”

She snorts and tosses back the rest of her beer. “How does one win a break-up?”

“See that girl in his arms? That’s how you win a breakup.”

Steve walks up to you and takes the open bar stool to your left. “Y/N, it’s good to see you. It’s been too long.”

You plaster on your best fake smile. “It’s been eight months, Steve. A lifetime it looks like.”

You look at his date over his shoulder and his cheeks flush. “Oh, yeah. Um- this is my fiancée, Peggy. Peggy this is Y/N.”

“It’s a pleasure,” Peggy says as she flashes a megawatt smile.

She shakes your hand, and you feel your heart breaking all over again. It’s that moment that the woman beside you speaks up.

“You’re not going to introduce me, baby?” You swing back towards her with wide eyes and she subtly winks at you. “I’m Carol. The girlfriend.”

Steve’s face falls for a second before he reaches out to shake Carol’s hand. “I didn’t realize you were seeing anyone.”

Carol wraps her arm around your waist and you shiver at her touch. “It’s sort of new.” 

Carol’s bell-like laughter warms you, and you give your first genuine smile of the evening. “It’s been a few months. But they’ve been wonderful.”

You can’t take your eyes off of Carol’s smile. Her arm feels secure and warm around your waist.

Steve clears his throat and your eyes dart back to him. “So, will you come?”

“What?”

“Will you come to the wedding?”

“With a plus one of course,” Peggy says with a grin.

Join my 1500 Follower Drabble Celebration

Steve walks up to you and takes the open bar stool to your left. “Y/N, it’s good to see you. It’s been too long.”

You plaster on your best fake smile. “It’s been eight months, Steve. A lifetime it looks like.”

You look at his date over his shoulder and his cheeks flush. “Oh, yeah. Um- this is my fiancée, Peggy. Peggy this is Y/N.”

“It’s a pleasure,” Peggy says as she flashes a megawatt smile.

She shakes your hand, and you feel your heart breaking all over again. It’s that moment that the woman beside you speaks up.

“You’re not going to introduce me, baby?” You swing back towards her with wide eyes and she subtly winks at you. “I’m Carol. The girlfriend.”

Steve’s face falls for a second before he reaches out to shake Carol’s hand. “I didn’t realize you were seeing anyone.”

Carol wraps her arm around your waist and you shiver at her touch. “It’s sort of new.” 

Carol’s bell-like laughter warms you, and you give your first genuine smile of the evening. “It’s been a few months. But they’ve been wonderful.”

You can’t take your eyes off of Carol’s smile. Her arm feels secure and warm around your waist.

Steve clears his throat and your eyes dart back to him. “So, will you come?”

“What?”

“Will you come to the wedding?”

“With a plus one of course,” Peggy says with a grin.

You choke on your drink when you see your ex walk into the bar. It takes everything in you not to vomit when you see the beautiful woman draped in his arms. 

“Is something wrong,” the woman next to you asks.

“My fucking ex just walked in and-” your eyes follow his path straight to you. “And it looks like he can’t resist showing me who won the break-up.”

She snorts and tosses back the rest of her beer. “How does one win a break-up?”

“See that girl in his arms? That’s how you win a breakup.”

Steve walks up to you and takes the open bar stool to your left. “Y/N, it’s good to see you. It’s been too long.”

You plaster on your best fake smile. “It’s been eight months, Steve. A lifetime it looks like.”

Carol wraps her arm around your waist and you shiver at her touch. “It’s sort of new.” 

Carol’s bell-like laughter warms you, and you give your first genuine smile of the evening. “It’s been a few months. But they’ve been wonderful.”

You can’t take your eyes off of Carol’s smile. Her arm feels secure and warm around your waist.

Steve clears his throat and your eyes dart back to him. “So, will you come?”
